author:
Chuck Barney

cbarney@bayareanewsgroup.com
title: 'Homeland,' 'Arrow,' 'The Flash' kick off new seasons
text:
'Homeland,' 'Arrow,' 'The Flash' kick off new seasons By Chuck Barney Posted: 10/02/2015 12:02:00 PM PDT Updated: 10/02/2015 01:54:42 PM PDT DON'T MISS: "Homeland" -- Season 5 of the acclaimed drama begins two years after the horrific embassy attack in Islamabad. No longer with the CIA, Carrie Mathison (Claire Danes) is building a new life with her daughter in Berlin. She's even in a stable relationship with a nice German lawyer (Alex Fehling). Oh, but you just know all hell will break loose soon. 9 p.m. Sunday, Showtime. Other bets SUNDAY: Raise your right hand. As "Madam Secretary" launches its second season, Elizabeth (TÃ©a Leoni) is suddenly thrust into a situation of power when the president's plane disappears over the Pacific Ocean. 8 p.m., CBS. Claire Danes as Carrie Mathison and Luna and Lotta Pfitzer as Franny in 'Homeland.' (Stephan Rabold/Showtime) SUNDAY: "The Good Wife" returns with fresh episodes and Alicia's (Julianna Margulies) life has taken on some new bumps. Hoping to salvage her law career, she enters the fast-paced, highly unglamorous world of bond court. 9 p.m., CBS. 
SUNDAY: There's a new setting for Season 2 of "The Leftovers." Kevin Garvey (Justin Theroux) and his family are relocating to a small Texas town dubbed Miracle because it lost no one during the Departure. Still, drama happens. 9 p.m., HBO. 
MONDAY: The pressure on team "Scorpion" just refuses to ease. Tonight, Sylvester (Ari Stidham) goes undercover in a federal prison, hoping to save the lives of three federal judges and, of course, he eventually needs help to break out. 9 p.m., CBS. Advertisement 
TUESDAY: "The Flash" is back in action, and as Season 2 begins, Barry Allen (Grant Justin) wants to protect Central City on his own. When the Atom Smasher attacks, Iris (Candice Patton) pleads with him to let his friends help. 8 p.m., The CW. 
TUESDAY: Brace yourself for a Shaq attack on "Fresh Off the Boat." Former NBA superstar Shaquille O'Neal makes a guest appearance on the sitcom that had previously given him several shout-outs. 8:30 p.m., ABC. 
WEDNESDAY: As Season 4 of "Arrow" begins, Oliver Queen (Stephen Amell) is away on a romantic escape. Luckily, John Diggle (David Ramsey) is around to battle assassins led by Damien Darhk (Neal McDonough). 8 p.m., The CW. 
WEDNESDAY: Seems you can check into the Los Angeles hot spot at the center of "American Horror Story: Hotel," but you can never leave. Maybe that's because it's owned by a demented countess played by Lady Gaga. 10 p.m., FX. 
THURSDAY: Season 7 of "The Vampire Diaries" opens with Elena out of the picture for good. That forces a bummed-out Damon (Ian Somerhalder) to try and move on. 8 p.m., The CW. 
FRIDAY: The sitcom "Undateable" returns with a daring little twist: This season, every episode will be broadcast live to the East Coast. But will that make the show any funnier? 8 p.m., NBC. 
SATURDAY: "The Unauthorized Melrose Place Story" is the latest gossipy film to dig into the behind-the-scenes dirt of an iconic TV show. Warning: You may need to take a shower after viewing. 8 p.m., Lifetime. Contact Chuck Barney at cbarney@bayareanewsgroup.com . Follow him at Twitter.com/chuckbarney and Facebook.com/bayareanewsgroup.chuckbarney .
